description: The "synthetic.project_issues" table represents individual issues or problems reported within projects, each uniquely identified by the primary key "issue_id." It contains columns detailing the issue's title, description, priority, severity, assignment, reporting, status, resolution, and timestamps for creation and last update, emphasizing issue tracking and management in a project setting. The table is referenced by foreign keys related to undefined entities, indicating it may serve as a central repository for project-related issues within the database schema.

columns.name: issue_id
columns.description: This column represents a sequential identifier for issues within a project, ensuring each issue has a unique and distinct reference number. Purpose beyond identification is unclear from available data.

columns.name: project_id
columns.description: Represents the unique identifier for projects, associating each issue with its corresponding project. Each number indicates a specific project to which an issue is linked.

columns.name: issue_title
columns.description: This column represents the titles or headings of issues related to projects, capturing diverse elements such as information, patterns, statements, or theories. The titles reflect a variety of themes, suggesting the issues could pertain to different phases or aspects of a project's lifecycle.

columns.name: description
columns.description: This column contains narrative descriptions or comments related to project issues, capturing miscellaneous thoughts, observations, or notes. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: priority
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data. The sample values do not provide a coherent indication of the columnâ€™s function in business terms.

columns.name: assigned_to
columns.description: This column likely identifies individuals or entities responsible for resolving or addressing specific issues within a project, using a unique numerical identifier. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: reported_by
columns.description: This column represents the unique identifier for a person or entity who reported a specific issue related to a project. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: status
columns.description: This column represents the current state or progress of a project issue, such as whether it is active, inactive, completed, or cancelled. The default status is 'open', suggesting an issue is initially considered active until updated.

columns.name: resolution
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data. The values seem to be fragmented or contain narrative text unrelated to common resolution terms.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a project issue is created. It serves as a time stamp for tracking the initiation of issues in the project management process.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column records the timestamp when a project issue was last updated, indicating the most recent modification activity. Purpose unclear from available data.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX project_issues_pkey ON synthetic.project_issues USING btree (issue_id)
